trans-unit.source: Represents the structure, or schema, of a data field.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class to get the properties of a data field using a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

You can discover the structure of a data field by using the following properties in this class: <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.DataType%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.IsReadOnly%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Length%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.IsUnique%2A>.

In addition, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Identity%2A> property to determine if a data column is set for <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A>, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.PrimaryKey%2A> property to determine if a data column is in the primary key.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class is used by custom control designer components to provide information about a data field at design time.
To examine the components of data using a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, use the following classes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema"></xref> class using a specified <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class to examine the properties of a data field using a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> object that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema"></xref> object describes.
Gets the type of data stored in the data field.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object that represents the type of data the data field contains.
Gets a value indicating whether the value of the data field automatically increments for each new row added to the table or view.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Identity%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.DataType"></xref> is numeric and the value of the column increments automatically as new rows are added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> is read-only.
`true` if the data field is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether values in the data field are required to be unique.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.IsUnique%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.
`true` if data in the data field is unique; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating the size of data that can be stored in the data field.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Length%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.MaxLength%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.
The number of bytes the column can store.
Gets the name of the data field.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Name%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.
The name of the data field.
Gets a value indicating whether the data field can accept `null` values.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Nullable%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AllowDBNull%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.
`true` if the data field can accept `null` values; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the maximum number of digits used to represent a numerical value in the data field.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Precision%2A> property is required by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface, but is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class.
This property always returns `-1`.
Gets a value indicating whether the data field is in the primary key for the containing table or view.
`true` if the data field is in the primary key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of decimal places to which numerical values in the data field are resolved.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Scale%2A> property is required by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface, but is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class.
This property always returns -1.
